TEXT.English: When checked, dead civilizations will be tagged as "DEAD" when shown.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, dead civilizations will be tagged as "DEAD" when shown.

TEXT.English: Select the size of the research icons when displayed (default value is 24).
TEXT.Chinese: Select the size of the research icons when displayed (default value is 24).

TEXT.English: Color used for high power ratios.
TEXT.Chinese: Color used for high power ratios.

TEXT.English: When checked, shows a count of the number of cities for each leader.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, shows a count of the number of cities for each leader.

TEXT.English: When checked, includes the current turn's change in the score change.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, includes the current turn's change in the score change.

TEXT.English: When checked, the human players' names are used in place of those of the leaders they are playing as.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, the human players' names are used in place of those of the leaders they are playing as.

TEXT.English: When checked, dead civilizations will remain on the scoreboard.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, dead civilizations will remain on the scoreboard.

TEXT.English: Select the maximum number of civilizations to display (0 for unlimited).
TEXT.Chinese: Select the maximum number of civilizations to display (0 for unlimited).

TEXT.English: Select the height of each civilization's line (default value is 22).
TEXT.Chinese: Select the height of each civilization's line (default value is 22).

TEXT.English: Select the formula to use for calculating the power ratio:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rival vs. You[COLOR_REVERT] - Lower numbers are better.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]You vs. Rival[COLOR_REVERT] - Higher numbers are better.
TEXT.Chinese: Select the formula to use for calculating the power ratio:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rival vs. You[COLOR_REVERT] - Lower numbers are better.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]You vs. Rival[COLOR_REVERT] - Higher numbers are better.

TEXT.English: Color used for low power ratios.
TEXT.Chinese: Color used for low power ratios.

TEXT.English: Power ratings greater than or equal to this value are shown in the High Color.
TEXT.Chinese: Power ratings greater than or equal to this value are shown in the High Color.

TEXT.English: When checked, shows the ratio of your power rating to those of civilizations against whom you have accumulated enough espionage points.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, shows the ratio of your power rating to those of civilizations against whom you have accumulated enough espionage points.

TEXT.English: When checked, vassals are group together under their master(s).
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, vassals are group together under their master(s).

TEXT.English: When checked, the scoreboard is drawn as a grid, and the other options in this column affect it.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, the scoreboard is drawn as a grid, and the other options in this column affect it.

TEXT.English: When checked, shows an angry person icon when you are an AI's worst enemy.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, shows an angry person icon when you are an AI's worst enemy.

TEXT.English: Power ratings less than or equal to this value are shown in in the Low Color.
TEXT.Chinese: Power ratings less than or equal to this value are shown in in the Low Color.

TEXT.English: When checked, minor civilizations are shown (some scenarios consider certain civs to be minor).
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, minor civilizations are shown (some scenarios consider certain civs to be minor).

TEXT.English: The spacing between columns (in pixels) to use when none is specified for a column.
TEXT.Chinese: The spacing between columns (in pixels) to use when none is specified for a column.

TEXT.English: Determines how civilizations are labeled on the scoreboard.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leader[COLOR_REVERT] - Name of the leader or player (Victoria or EmperorFool).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Civilization[COLOR_REVERT] - Name of the civilization (England).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Description[COLOR_REVERT] - Descriptive name of the civilization (English Empire).
TEXT.Chinese: Determines how civilizations are labeled on the scoreboard.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leader[COLOR_REVERT] - Name of the leader or player (Victoria or EmperorFool).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Civilization[COLOR_REVERT] - Name of the civilization (England).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Description[COLOR_REVERT] - Descriptive name of the civilization (English Empire).

TEXT.English: Color used by default for power ratios.
TEXT.Chinese: Color used by default for power ratios.

TEXT.English: When checked, shows faces depicting each AI's attitude toward you.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, shows faces depicting each AI's attitude toward you.

TEXT.English: When checked, shows an orange fist icon when the AI is mobilizing for war (We Have Enough on Our Hands).
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, shows an orange fist icon when the AI is mobilizing for war (We Have Enough on Our Hands).

TEXT.English: When checked, the civ/leader name is left-aligned instead of right-aligned.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, the civ/leader name is left-aligned instead of right-aligned.

TEXT.English: When checked, shows icons instead of names for civs whose research you can see.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, shows icons instead of names for civs whose research you can see.

TEXT.English: When checked, shows the change in score since the previous turn
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, shows the change in score since the previous turn

TEXT.English: This determines the order in which the score columns appear.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]W[COLOR_REVERT] - You are at war or have a peace treaty with the civ.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]S[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's score.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Z[COLOR_REVERT] - The change in the civ's score since previous turn.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]K[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's rank based on their score.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Q[COLOR_REVERT] - The number of cities the civ owns.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]V[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ has at least one vassal.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]I[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's player ID number.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]C[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's/leader's/player's name.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]?[COLOR_REVERT] - You have not yet met the civ.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]E[COLOR_REVERT] - You have a positive espionage point ratio against the civ.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]P[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's power ratio compared to you.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]T[COLOR_REVERT] - The tech the civ is researching (vassals, teammates and espionage).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]U[COLOR_REVERT] - The number of research turns left.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]N[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ is connected to your trade network.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]B[COLOR_REVERT] - You have an open borders agreement with the civ.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]D[COLOR_REVERT] - You have a defensive pact with the civ.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]R[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's state religion.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]A[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's attitude toward you.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]H[COLOR_REVERT] - You are the civ's worst enemy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]F[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ refuses to talk to you.[DLL=1][NEWLINE] [DLLMSG][/DLL][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]M[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ is mobilizing for war (WHEOOH).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]*[COLOR_REVERT] - This civ is waiting for you to finish your turn in multiplayer.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]L[COLOR_REVERT] - Civ's network stats (ping).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]O[COLOR_REVERT] - The network player is out-of-sync.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]^[COLOR_REVERT] - Civ's stability level.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]@[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ is suffering from a plague.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You can place a number (positive or negative) between column codes to override the default spacing.
TEXT.Chinese: This determines the order in which the score columns appear.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]W[COLOR_REVERT] - You are at war or have a peace treaty with the civ.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]S[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's score.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Z[COLOR_REVERT] - The change in the civ's score since previous turn.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]K[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's rank based on their score.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Q[COLOR_REVERT] - The number of cities the civ owns.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]V[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ has at least one vassal.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]I[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's player ID number.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]C[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's/leader's/player's name.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]?[COLOR_REVERT] - You have not yet met the civ.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]E[COLOR_REVERT] - You have a positive espionage point ratio against the civ.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]P[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's power ratio compared to you.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]T[COLOR_REVERT] - The tech the civ is researching (vassals, teammates and espionage).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]U[COLOR_REVERT] - The number of research turns left.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]N[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ is connected to your trade network.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]B[COLOR_REVERT] - You have an open borders agreement with the civ.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]D[COLOR_REVERT] - You have a defensive pact with the civ.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]R[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's state religion.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]A[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ's attitude toward you.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]H[COLOR_REVERT] - You are the civ's worst enemy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]F[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ refuses to talk to you.[DLL=1][NEWLINE] [DLLMSG][/DLL][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]M[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ is mobilizing for war (WHEOOH).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]*[COLOR_REVERT] - This civ is waiting for you to finish your turn in multiplayer.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]L[COLOR_REVERT] - Civ's network stats (ping).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]O[COLOR_REVERT] - The network player is out-of-sync.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]^[COLOR_REVERT] - Civ's stability level.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]@[COLOR_REVERT] - The civ is suffering from a plague.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You can place a number (positive or negative) between column codes to override the default spacing.

TEXT.English: Number of decimal places to show for power ratio display.
TEXT.Chinese: Number of decimal places to show for power ratio display.

TEXT.English: When checked, dead civilizations will be greyed out when not shown.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, dead civilizations will be greyed out when not shown.
